results.title: The Swans of Abbotsbury
results.brief_description: A pictorial description of the famous swannery of Abbotsbury in Dorset. Over 500 pairs of swans dwell in the grounds of the ancient Benedictine Monastery of Abbotsbury, and in the pleasant acres leading to the river banks the graceful birds live and rear their young; shows the parent birds at their nest, and the appearance of the fledglings.

results.title: The Swan song by Anton Chekhov
results.brief_description: The curtain rises in an old theatre, the audience and the cleaning women have all gone home. It is dark and musty and the stage has been cleared of all scenery. There is silence. Then a candlelight appears, illuminating a face…it is the face of The Actor, rouged, lined and old. The Actor encounters someone else, the Theatre Prompter, who becomes an unwilling audience and the two men share each other’s loneliness on the darkened stage. Adapted from Chekhov’s 1886 stage version of his short story, the film illustrates the adaptability of the short story form to a moving, audiovisual experience.

results.title: The Swan princess
results.brief_description: Princess Odette is betrothed to Prince Derek, but after he unsuccessfully explains why he loves her, beyond her beauty, she flees heartbroken with her father. On the journey, trouble befalls them when the carriage is attacked by the evil Rothbart; an enchanter who was banished from King William’s (Odette’s father) kingdom for treason. Rothbart places a spell on Odette, turning her into a swan and demanding that she marry him. The only time Odette returns to her human form is when moonlight touches her wings, as soon as it disappears, wherever she is, her form returns to that of the swan. Assisted by her three new forest friends, Jean Bob (a frog), Speed (a turtle) and Puffin (a bird), Odette tries to overthrow the power of her captor while Derek tries to be reunited with his love and avoid the matchmaking efforts of his parents. Features the voices of Jack Palance, Howard McGillin, Michelle Nicastro, John Cleese and Steven Wright.

results.title: The Swan
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Dore Schary and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Days after the release of “The Swan”, Grace Kelly became a real Princess by marrying Prince Rainer of Monaco. In this film, she is a Eurpoean Princess destined to marry the Crown Prince (Alec Guinness). Princess Alexandra is more interested in studying astronomy with her tutor than marriage plans, yet once she sees the Prince, it is love at first sight. Capturing his attention, let alone his affections, proves difficult, until Princess Beatrix, Alex’s mother, connives a scheme to make the Prince jealous. Co-starring Louis Jourdan, Agnes Moorehead, Jessie Royce Landis and Leo G. Carroll.

results.title: The Swallowtail story: the life history of an English butterfly
results.brief_description: Shows the English swallowtail butterfly in its British habitat, the extensive areas of reed beds round the Norfolk Broads in East Anglia, together with other wild life in the district. The conflict with human activities, either by drainage of the fens to provide more agricultural land, or holiday pursuits such as sailing on the Broads, is shown as well as the steps taken to ensure the future conservation of this beautiful insect. Commentary and entomology by Victor Bascombe.

results.title: The Surveyors level
results.brief_description: Discusses the theory and practice of levelling, with particular regard to the steps necessary to check and to maintain instruments in a proper state of adjustment. The latter section of the film illustrates the use of the Geodetic Level and finally how this level was used by the Geodetic Survey of Canada to run out a hundred miles of control levels along the Red River.

results.title: The Surf boats of Accra
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: For over 500 years the surf boats of Accra have carried cargoes ashore. Today this old practice is dying out but there are still some crews left. We see the skill and strength of the men as they drive their boats back and forth through the pounding surf competing with each other for the loads of cargo.

results.title: The Sure thing
results.creator_credit: Richard Taylor and W.M. Larkins Studio
results.brief_description: A cartoon explaining the basic principles of insurance underwriting, the principles which govern the investment policy of insurance companies and their operations overseas.

results.title: The Sure thing
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Roger Birnbaum and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Walt Gibson, “Gib”, is a college freshman from the East Coast obsessed with “scoring”. After striking out with fellow student, Alison - the control freak, he decides to head west to California after his best friend assures him of a “sure thing”. What Gib doesn’t know is that Alison is also planning a trip to California to visit her stuffy fiancee. They end up sharing the same ride and misadventures, which ultimately draws them together. Cast includes: John Cusack, Daphne Zuniga, Boyd Gaines, Tim Robbins, Lisa Persky and Anthony Edwards.

results.title: The Supernatural
results.creator_credit: Susan McMillan, James Honeyborne, John Downer, Discovery Channel and BBC
results.brief_description: ‘Supernatural’ is a visually compelling investigation of the extrasensory and near-paranormal powers utilized by various animals in their daily struggle for survival. The series is presented in six parts, each focusing on examples of amazing and sometimes inexplicable animal and plant behaviour. In ‘Extrasensory perception’, watch sharks use electrosensors to track prey, and see a flight over the Sydney Opera House through the eyes of a parrot using ultraviolet light as a guide. ‘Outer limits’ explores incredible feats of endurance; lungfish burrowing into mud to escape droughts, and red sided garter snakes “defrosting” themselves after a cold snap. ‘Hidden forces’ looks at the internal magnet which draws green turtles back to the beaches of their birth to breed, and how fire ants are attracted to electric currents. ‘Time warp’ investigates how animal size and heart-rate are linked to lifespan. ‘Paranormal’ looks at the more bizarre side of nature; lizards who squirt blood from their eyes to deter predators and chickens and crocodiles who play dead when hypnotised. ‘Close encounters’ looks at the role enhanced senses play in animal life, using the story of Whisky, a truck-driver’s dog, and his six month journey to track down his owner. Also included is ‘Supernatural superstars’, a behind-the-scenes look at how the latest developments in science, cutting edge filming techniques and state of the art computer effects allowed the filmmakers to bring such an ambitious project to life.
